result.execSummary:
The defendant Bradley R. Valcq was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: All Financial obligations shall be paid to the Clerk of Courts within 60 days unless a payment plan is established.

If Defendant does not complete TAD program, this PA bond is revoked and Defendant to be held without bond until sentencing.

14CF417 & 15CF47: Defendant Bradley R. Valcq in court, in custody with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Def.'s father and roommate are present in courtroom; Def. is on $10,000 cash bail on 15CF47, will be converted to PA bond and Def. to enter TAD program, but if Def. does not finish program, PA bond would automatically be revoked and Def. will sit without bond until sentencing; Atty. Wineke notes that Def. has been accepted to TAD program; Court reviews GPQPA & WOR; Court reviews charges/penalties; Def. pleads NC to Poss. of Morphine in Count 1 of 14CF417, NC to Poss. of Heroin in Count 1 of 15CF47 and NC to BJ in Count 3 of 15CF47; Court notes, once Def. completes the TAD program, he is to come back for sentencing; program could take 9 months; TSC set; Court orders bond amended to $10,000 PA bond with same conditions; Def. remanded

Defendant Bradley R. Valcq in court, in custody via video with Intern Austin Heimann w/supervising attorney Jaclyn Shelton (eligible).  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, within time limits. Prelim set. Court sets $10,000 Cash bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without permission from this Court.  Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with RJZ w/f 4/7/87.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
